Depends on the velocities of the three balls
1.q_string: If three balls are dropped simultaneously from the top of a tower, then the acceleration of the centre of mass of the three balls during the motion:

q_option: Positive for some particles and negative for other particles
1.q_string: The X- coordinates of the particles of a system of bodies whose centre of mass is at origin will be?
Two bodies of masses \(5 {~kg}\) and \(10 {~kg}\) are moving towards each other with equal velocities of \(15 {~m/sec}\). Find the velocity of the centre of mass.
A wheel is rolling on a plane surface as shown. The centre of the wheel moves with a speed \(v_{0}\). Then the speed of the particle at \(P\) is:
A particle is in circular motion in a vertical plane. If the direction of the velocity at the top most point is towards the east, then the direction of angular velocity is towards:
A rotating wheel has angular speed \({f}_{0}\) rpm. What is the angular speed in radian per second?

A flywheel of mass \(6000 {~kg}\) starts from rest and gets up to a speed of \(20 {~rad} / \mathrm{s}\) in 2 minutes. The radius of gyration of the wheel is \(100 {~cm}\). The average torque exerted on the flywheel is:
If a solid disc was rotating along the x-y axis as shown below, in such case the direction of torque will be:

A couple of \(10^{5}\) Nm is applied to a fly wheel of mass \(10 \mathrm{~kg}\) and radius of gyration \(50 \mathrm{~m}\). The angular acceleration of the wheel in \(\mathrm{rad} / \mathrm{s}^{2}\) is:

A door of \(1.6 {~m}\) wide requires a force of \(1 {~N}\) to be applied at the free end to open or close it. The force that is required at a point \(0.4 {~m}\) distant from the hinges for opening or closing the door is:
\(120 {~N}\) of force is required to open a nut using a spanner of length \(10 {~cm}\). If another spanner of length \(6 {~cm}\) is used to open the same nut, what amount of force has to applied?
Moment of inertia, rotational kinetic energy, and angular momentum of a body is \(I, E\), and \(L\) respectively then:

A rod of length (L) \(15 {~m}\) is rotating about an axis passing through its one end and velocity at a point which is at \(\frac{L }{ 3}\) distance from the axis is \(15 {~m} / {s}\). Find the linear velocity of the free end of the rod.

1.q_string: A string is wound round a hollow cylinder of mass \(3 {~kg}\) and radians \(40 {~cm}\). The string is pulled with a force of 50 Newton. The angular acceleration of cylinder will be:
Find the radius of gyration of a disc of mass \({M}\) and radius \({R}\) rotating about an axis passing through the center of mass and perpendicular to the plane of the disc.

From a circular disc of radius \({R}\) and mass \(9 {M}\), a small disc of mass \({M}\) and radius \(\frac{R}{3}\) is removed concentrically. The moment of inertia of the remaining disc about an axis perpendicular to the plane of the disc and passing through its centre is:

q_option: The ring and the disc have the same kinetic energy
Kinetic energies of both the bodies are zero since they are not in linear motion

If the mass and moment of inertia of a solid sphere and spherical shell are the same, the ratio of their radii will be:

The moment of inertia of a rod of mass \({M}\) and length \({l}\) about an axis passing through its centre and perpendicular to its length is \(0.084\) \({M} {l}^{2}\). Then the moment of inertia of the rod about an axis passing through one of its ends and parallel to the given axis will be:
The moment of inertia of a body is always minimum about an axis parallel to its:

q_option: Algebraic sum of the moments of all forces acting on the body, about a fixed point is infinity.
Algebraic sum of the moments of all forces acting on the body, about a fixed point is a non zero finite quantity
Algebraic sum of the moments of all forces acting on the body, about a fixed point is zero.

A solid sphere of radius \(R\) is rolling on a horizontal plank with velocity \(V^{'}\). The plank itself is moving with velocity \(V_{}\) on the ground. What is the relationship between \(V^{'}\) and \(V\)?
The linear momentum of the body is increased by \(30 \%\). Calculate the percentile change in the kinetic energy of the particle if the mass of the particle is constant.
A body of mass \(1 {~kg}\) undergoes a change in velocity from \(2 {~m} / {s}\) to \(3 {~m} / {s}\) in \(2\) seconds, when a force is applied to it. The rate of change of linear momentum will be:
The moment of inertia of a thin rod of mass \({M}\) and length \({L}\) about an axis through one of its ends and perpendicular to length is:
